crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ip [146.47.0.0/16,146.51.0.0/16,146.106.0.0/16,146.183.0.0/16,146.185.222.0/24,146.202.0.0/16,146.252.0.0/16,147.7.0.0/16,147.16.0.0/14,147.45.44.0/24,147.45.47.0/24,147.45.124.0/23,147.78.20.0/22,147.78.224.0/22,147.119.0.0/16,148.148.0.0/16,148.154.0.0/16,148.178.0.0/16,148.185.0.0/16,148.248.0.0/16] any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET DROP Spamhaus DROP Listed Traffic Inbound group 23"; reference:url,www.spamhaus.org/drop/drop.txt; threshold: type limit, track by_src, seconds 3600, count 1; classtype:misc-attack; flowbits:set,ET.Evil; flowbits:set,ET.DROPIP; sid:2400022; rev:4140; metadata:affected_product Any, attack_target Any, deployment Perimeter, tag Dshield, signature_severity Minor, created_at 2010_12_30, updated_at 2024_10_23;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Executable Download from dotted-quad Host"; flow:established,to_server; http.uri; content:".exe"; endswith; nocase; http.host; content:"."; offset:1; depth:3; content:"."; within:4; content:"."; within:4; pcre:"/^(?:\d{1,3}\.){3}\d{1,3}$/"; http.request_line; content:".exe HTTP/1."; fast_pattern; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2016141; rev:9; metadata:attack_target Client_and_Server, created_at 2013_01_03, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Significant, signature_severity Informational, updated_at 2024_04_09;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Dotted Quad Host MZ Response
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert http $EXTERNAL_NET any -> $HOME_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING SUSPICIOUS Dotted Quad Host MZ Response"; flow:established,to_client; flowbits:isset,http.dottedquadhost; file_data; content:"MZ"; within:2; content:"PE|00 00|"; distance:0; classtype:bad-unknown; sid:2021076; rev:2; metadata:created_at 2015_05_08, updated_at 2019_07_26;)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Bad Opsec Defaults Sacrificial Processes With Improper Arguments
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects attackers using tooling with bad opsec defaults.
E.g. spawning a sacrificial process to inject a capability into the process without taking into account how the process is normally run.
One trivial example of this is using rundll32.exe without arguments as a sacrificial process (default in CS, now highlighted by c2lint), running WerFault without arguments (Kraken - credit am0nsec), and other examples.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Oleg Kolesnikov @securonix invrep_de, oscd.community, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Christian Burkard (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\Temp\; OriginalFileName=RUNDLL32.EXE; Hashes=MD5=EF3179D498793BF4234F708D3BE28633,SHA256=B53F3C0CD32D7F20849850768DA6431E5F876B7BFA61DB0AA0700B02873393FA,IMPHASH=4DB27267734D1576D75C991DC70F68AC; Description=Windows host process (Rundll32); EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\more.com; CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe; FileVersion=10.0.19041.746 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\more.com; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\Temp\; OriginalFileName=RUNDLL32.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=2F34CCFDD8141AEEE2E89FFB070CE239C7D00706,MD5=73C519F050C20580F8A62C849D49215A,SHA256=38847DC4C82C0775E7DAFCBC7FEA50749CDAC7B50AB8602E8FDFAD4401954C87,IMPHASH=F27A7FC3A53E74F45BE370131953896A; Description=Windows host process (Rundll32); FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\more.com; CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\SysWOW64\more.com; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\rundll32.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Tim Shelton, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Yassine Oukessou
